definition: Swat province in Pakistani Northwest Frontier
Slovakia/Slovak/abbr. for 斯洛伐克[Si1 luo4 fa2 ke4]
(phonetic)/this
roof tile/abbr. for 瓦特[wa3 te4]
special/unique/distinguished/especially/unusual/very/abbr. for 特克斯[te4 ke4 si1], tex
Swat valley in Pakistani Northwest Frontier

sentences.english: The army has recaptured territory, including Swat's main town, Mingora.
sentences.chinese: 军队夺回了该领土，包括斯瓦特的主要城镇明戈拉。

sentences.english: "It seems they have left their places in Swat, " he said.
sentences.chinese: “他们看起来已经离开了斯瓦特的阵地”，他说道。

sentences.english: The arrests in Swat are the latest blow for the Taliban insurgents in Pakistan whose chief commander Baitullah Mehsud was killed in a suspected U.
sentences.chinese: 斯瓦特的被捕是对巴基斯坦叛乱分子最近的一次打击。

sentences.english: The Swat Valley was under the control of Taliban extremists for more than three years.
sentences.chinese: 塔利班极端分子对斯瓦特山谷地区的控制已有三年多。

sentences.english: But during the conflict in the Swat Valley, they were captured by Pakistani soldiers.
sentences.chinese: 在斯瓦特河谷冲突中，他们被巴基斯塔士兵俘虏了。

sentences.english: The top leader of the militants in Swat, Maulana Fazlullah, is still at large.
sentences.chinese: 斯瓦特的塔利班头目之一法兹鲁拉仍然在逃。

sentences.english: The number of these seeds is equal to the number of displaced people from Swat Valley.
sentences.chinese: 这些种子的数量相当于斯瓦特山谷流离失所的人数。

Pali, language of Theravad Pali canon/Barry (name)/Gareth Barry (1981-), English footballer
Lhozhag county, Tibetan: Lho brag rdzong, in Lhokha prefecture 山南地區|山南地区[Shan1 nan2 di4 qu1], Tibet
Mohammed (c. 570-632), central figure of Islam and prophet of God
Ladakh, the eastern part of Jammu and Kashmir in northwest India, adjacent to Kashmir and Tibet, know as "Little Tibet"

Karakhan dynasty of central Asia, 8th-10th century
